result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:46 AM Defendant Jeremiah J Butson in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court for Jeremiah J Butson.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Victim in appearance today and agrees to conditions of the deferred prosecution agreement. Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Defendant is in court with Attorney Bennett by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bennett received complaint , waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts waiver and enters pleas. Court sets pre trial for June 14th at 11:45 am. bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremiah J Butson appeared in court without counsel. Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant received complaint. Defendant applied for a court appointed. Court grants court appointed attorney. Defendant enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts pleas and sets status for April 11th at 9:30 am. bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing on April 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant appears in court without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received complaint.   Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Court adjourns initial appearance to March 7th at 10:00 am to allow time for counsel. bond continued.

Defendant appears by video without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court adjourns initial appearance to February 14th at 11:00 am to allow time for counsel. bond continued.
